meanings.definition: To appoint or elect into a group or organization
meanings.sent1: The club decided to coopt a new member to join their team.
meanings.sent2: She coopted her friend to help with the project.
meanings.sent3: The team coopted the shy student to participate in the game.
meanings.sent4: The company coopted the talented artist to work on their designs.
meanings.sent5: He coopted the skilled chef to cook for the event.

meanings.definition: To win over or persuade someone to join a cause or group
meanings.sent1: The charity managed to coopt many volunteers for their event.
meanings.sent2: She coopted her classmates to support her idea.
meanings.sent3: The magician coopted the audience with his amazing tricks.
meanings.sent4: Her speech coopted the listeners with its powerful message.
meanings.sent5: He coopted his friends to join him on the adventure.

meanings.definition: To take over or appropriate something for one's own use
meanings.sent1: The company tried to coopt the competitor's customers by offering better deals.
meanings.sent2: She coopted the idea and presented it as her own.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to coopt the dog's bed for a nap.
meanings.sent4: The artist coopted the street art style for his new painting.
meanings.sent5: He coopted the recipe and added his own twist to it.
